body:
Graphic card ?

Le ven. 9 août 2019 à 00:09, Ozamatheus <notifications@github.com> a écrit :

> Expected behavior
>
> i'm following Basic workflow video and data_dst and data_src extract faces
> (any bat) don't work
> Actual behavior
>
> all images found
> 0 faces detected
> Steps to reproduce
>
> -i'm using the default videos (iron man and chroma keyer guy)
> -i extract images from data_src and data_dst (this bats work normally)
> -i run the extract face bats, it found images but not the faces
> -if i use the MANUAL.bat it work and save some faces on aligned folder,
> but it cost a lot of time and lost a lot of faces
> -at this point i don't have enough images to proceed
> Other relevant information
>
> my rig:
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> *MOBO ASUS m5a97 EVO R2.0 fx8320 Gigabyte RX580 8gb vengeance 8gb 1600mhz
> ssd 120gb win 10 no overclock, all drivers up to date python last versions
> instaled no firewall interruptions*

body:
I'm having the same issue (same GPU)

Edit: I've found a solution. You can force the face extraction to run on your CPU instead of your GPU. That fixed it for me, although it takes much longer.

> I'm having the same issue (same GPU)
> 
> Edit: I've found a solution. You can force the face extraction to run on your CPU instead of your GPU. That fixed it for me, although it takes much longer.

how?
I'm encountering the following error:
"  File "imp.py", line 243, in load_module
  File "imp.py", line 343, in load_dynamic
ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.


Failed to load the native TensorFlow runtime.

See https://www.tensorflow.org/install/errors

for some common reasons and solutions.  Include the entire stack trace
above this error message when asking for help."

installed cuda, cudnn & TF but still nothing..

> > I'm having the same issue (same GPU)
> > Edit: I've found a solution. You can force the face extraction to run on your CPU instead of your GPU. That fixed it for me, although it takes much longer.
> 
> how?
> I'm encountering the following error:
> " File "imp.py", line 243, in load_module
> File "imp.py", line 343, in load_dynamic
> ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.
> 
> Failed to load the native TensorFlow runtime.
> 
> See https://www.tensorflow.org/install/errors
> 
> for some common reasons and solutions. Include the entire stack trace
> above this error message when asking for help."

When using your CPU, you're limited in what options you can use. You can for example only use MT Extractor. You can enable CPU extraction by adding the --CPU-ONLY argument (I think. I'm not at my workstation at the moment). I suggest duplicating the MT extraction bat-file, and adding that argument. (I tried with S3FD first, and got an import error, so I thought you might also have tried it with S3FD)

> When using your CPU, you're limited in what options you can use. You can for example only use MT Extractor. You can enable CPU extraction by adding the --CPU-ONLY argument (I think. I'm not at my workstation at the moment). I suggest duplicating the MT extraction bat-file, and adding that argument. (I tried with S3FD first, and got an import error, so I thought you might also have tried it with S3FD)

you can confirm how to do this? i don't want extract 2000+ faces manually, i just extracted 600 and took like 20 minutes :C

> you can confirm how to do this? i don't want extract 2000+ faces manually, i just extracted 600 and took like 20 minutes :C

I'm not currently at home, so I can't give you exact instructions. I can try though:
In the folder, where all the .bat files are located. Find the step 5 "data_dst extract faces MT.bat" (I'm not sure on the name)(Probably works with the src extraction .bat files as well, but I didn't change them, so I can't guarantee). If you right-click it and choose "edit", you can edit the .bat file. There you will see a list of arguments (they start with 2 dashes). By adding "--CPU-ONLY" to the arguments, you should be able to extract the faces from the images.

I'll probably be able to help you better if you give me the contents of the .bat file.

To anyone having problems in here.
Attached is a zip file with two .bat files, that will extract the faces from the destination and the source on the CPU. It will take longer, but it might work. Drop those .bat files in the folder with all the other .bat files, and tr them. They might work.
[Extract faces on the CPU.zip](https://github.com/iperov/DeepFaceLab/files/3505759/Extract.faces.on.the.CPU.zip)

You shouldn't need to install anything if you're using the pre-built binary provided in the releases section.

Additionally, could anyone here do a git bisect and nail down the commit that caused you to stop being able to extract images? It would help more than saying it simply doesn't work.

Ellesmere (OpenCL) doesnt response, terminating it.") . It works but cost like 30 minutes to extract 800 faces. The train is working on GPU normally btw

issue.title: Update Extractor.py, fixes issues with AMD GPUs, see #335

repository.name: DeepFaceLab
repository.description: DeepFaceLab is the leading software for creating deepfakes.

issue.body:
increased no_response_time_sec, fixes issues with AMD GPUs
fixes #335

body:
i just added a pull request for this issue.

From what i can tell the Subprocess waits for a maximum of 60 seconds for a response from the GPU but does not receive it in time. At least that is the problem with my AMD RX 560X.
After increasing that timeout to 600 seconds (10 minutes) i can successfully extract the faces.

If you want to apply my patch manually just open then file

**DeepFaceLab_OpenCL_SSE\\_internal\DeepFaceLab\mainscripts\Extractor.py** and change the line **305** from

`no_response_time_sec = 60 if not self.manual and not DEBUG else 999999`

to

`no_response_time_sec = 600 if not self.manual and not DEBUG else 999999`

afterwards, run the extract batch files again.

issue.title: Face extraction doesn't work with GPU

repository.name: DeepFaceLab
repository.description: DeepFaceLab is the leading software for creating deepfakes.

issue.body:
## Expected behavior

Extracting face using GPU(AMD)

## Actual behavior

No extracted face after running for a while, on GPU. But when I run it with CPU with the following parameters(CPU only) it's fine.
```
@echo off
call _internal\setenv.bat

"%PYTHON_EXECUTABLE%" "%DFL_ROOT%\main.py" extract ^
    --input-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_src" ^
    --output-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_src\aligned" ^
    --cpu-only ^
    --detector mt ^
    --debug-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_src\aligned_debug"

pause
```

## Steps to reproduce

I've tried a lot of times to use the GPU but it just gets stuck. Don't know if this occurs to others as well.

## Other relevant information
Using the prebuilt version, trying with a VEGA 64, also tried with an RX560, same result.
This issue looks very much like https://github.com/iperov/DeepFaceLab/issues/277

After I extract faces with the CPU parameters from ^, it works well with the SAE algorithm.

body: You guys were all using AMD graph card, even the same gpu. But I was using gtx 1050ti, so why the same problem appeared, images founded, no faces detected. It seems I am the only who using nvdia got the problem. Sad.
@CheungYuHui and did you try the fix i proposed? does anything change with that?
